titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Triangle Raging Grannies records RL.11296
titlestmt.author: Valerie Szwaya and Megan E. Lewis

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-17 08:29:58 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Raging Grannies is an activist organization that promotes peace, justice and social and economic equality by raising consciousness through song and satire. They also aim to challenge stereotypical assumptions about advocacy and aging. This collection contains materials documenting the Triangle chapter of the Raging Grannies in North Carolina from 1998-2015.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Triangle Raging Grannies records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Triangle Chapter of the Raging Grannies was founded in 1998, and operates in Raleigh, Durham, and Chapel Hill, North Carolina. Raging Grannies are a social justice activist organization made up of women over the age of 50. Raging Grannies was founded in British Columbia, Canada in 1986, and now has chapters around the world. Members often sing at rallies, protests, and demonstrations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The items are arranged in the chronological order in which they were received.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: The Triangle Raging Grannies records consist of photographs, newspaper clippings, protest song lyrics, member lists, flyers and other paraphernalia related to the activities of the organization around the Triangle area of North Carolina.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Triangle Raging Granny records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Valerie Szwaya, 2016. Accession described in this collection guide: 2015-0110.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.
